Selected Answer: A
This is a tricky question.
Authentication, Access Control, and Security can be configured. And these are the parts of the Cloud Services layer.
On the other hand Query processing layer consists of Virtual Data Warehouses which also can be configured (size and auto-scaling options).
But I would most probably go for A.

comments.content: Snowflake manages all aspects of how the data is stored and organized, and the user cannot modify them.

questions.question_text: Which Snowflake layer can be configured?

discussion.content:
D. Cloud services layer
https://community.snowflake.com/s/article/Snowflake-Additional-Billing-Cloud-Services-Layer-Impact#:~:text=The%20services%20layer%20for%20Snowflake,cache%20and%20coordinates%20all%20transactions.

Ans - D.
Query execution is different from Query processing. Query execution is performed in the processing layer. While The services layer for Snowflake authenticates user sessions, provides management, enforces security functions, performs query compilation and optimization, results cache and coordinates all transactions
Cloud services layer

Selected Answer: D
D. Cloud services layer

The Cloud Services layer in Snowflake is responsible for activities such as query optimization, compilation, and overall management of the system.

I expect to have 2% or so wrong answers but 70% is unacceptable is causing more confusion that helping at this point. For a paying customer, I would say that is absolutely unacceptable.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
ALTER TABLE <name> DROP CLUSTERING KEY
C is correct answer

Selected Answer: C
Dropping the Clustering Keys for a Table
At any time, you can drop the clustering key for a table using ALTER TABLE:

ALTER TABLE <name> DROP CLUSTERING KEY
